snippet: Free-to-download mobile games have become a lucrative business, but aggressive appeals for in-app purchases are turning off some players.
abstract: Regulators around the world are examining whether some free mobile games mislead consumers about true costs of playing them and whether vulnerable players, such as children, may be duped into spending money; so-called freemium model, in which games are free but players can pay small fees, is receiving pushback from both regulators and players and game developers, who worry that model is ruining culture of gaming.
lead_paragraph: Free-to-download mobile games have become a lucrative business, but aggressive appeals for in-app purchases are turning off some players.

headline.main: Free Video Games Say Pay Up or Wait, Testing Players’ Patience
headline.print_headline: Free Games Say Pay Up or Wait, Testing Patience
